#!/bin/sh

    echo "âŒ Slack API key not available in pre-fetched secrets"
    exit 1

# Check if channel already exists

if [ -f "$CHECKPOINT_FILE" ]; then
    echo "âœ… Channel already exists"
    cat "$CHECKPOINT_FILE" | jq -r '.channel_id'
    exit 0
fi

URGENCY=$(echo "$incident_analysis" | jq -r '.urgency_level')
CATEGORY=$(echo "$incident_analysis" | jq -r '.incident_category')
ESCALATION=$(echo "$incident_analysis" | jq -r '.escalation_required')
ETR=$(echo "$incident_analysis" | jq -r '.estimated_resolution_time')

CHANNEL_NAME="inc-$incident_id-$CATEGORY-$(echo "$incident_title" | tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]' | sed 's/[^a-z0-9-]/-/g' | cut -c1-15)"

case $URGENCY in
    "immediate") URGENCY_EMOJI="ðŸš¨ðŸš¨" ;;
    "high") URGENCY_EMOJI="ðŸš¨" ;;
    "medium") URGENCY_EMOJI="âš ï¸" ;;
    "low") URGENCY_EMOJI="ðŸ””" ;;
esac

RESPONSE=$(curl -s -X POST "https://slack.com/api/conversations.create" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer $SLACK_API_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d "{
    \"name\": \"$CHANNEL_NAME\",
    \"is_private\": false,

tools.name: cluster-health
tools.content:
#!/bin/bash
set -e

# Configure kubectl if in cluster
if [ -f "/var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/token" ]; then
    kubectl config set-cluster kubernetes --server=https://kubernetes.default.svc --certificate-authority=/var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/ca.crt
    kubectl config set-credentials kubernetes --token=$(cat /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/token)
    kubectl config set-context kubernetes --cluster=kubernetes --user=kubernetes
    kubectl config use-context kubernetes
fi

echo "ðŸ¥ Comprehensive Cluster Health Analysis"
echo "======================================="

echo "\nðŸ–¥ï¸  Node Status:"
kubectl get nodes -o wide --no-headers | while read line; do
    node_name=$(echo $line | awk '{print $1}')
    status=$(echo $line | awk '{print $2}')
    if [ "$status" = "Ready" ]; then
        echo "  âœ… $node_name: $status"
    else
        echo "  âŒ $node_name: $status"
    fi
done

echo "\nðŸ› ï¸  Critical Pod Issues:"
kubectl get pods --all-namespaces --field-selector=status.phase!=Running,status.phase!=Succeeded --no-headers | while read line; do
    if [ -n "$line" ]; then
        namespace=$(echo $line | awk '{print $1}')
        pod=$(echo $line | awk '{print $2}')
        status=$(echo $line | awk '{print $4}')
        echo "  âŒ $namespace/$pod: $status"
    fi
done

echo "\nðŸš€ Deployment Health:"
kubectl get deployments --all-namespaces --no-headers | while read line; do
    namespace=$(echo $line | awk '{print $1}')
    name=$(echo $line | awk '{print $2}')
    ready=$(echo $line | awk '{print $3}')
    desired=$(echo $ready | cut -d'/' -f2)
    current=$(echo $ready | cut -d'/' -f1)
    if [ "$current" = "$desired" ] && [ "$desired" != "0" ]; then
        echo "  âœ… $namespace/$name: $ready"
    else
        echo "  âš ï¸  $namespace/$name: $ready"
    fi
done

echo "\nðŸ“Š Resource Usage Summary:"
kubectl top nodes 2>/dev/null || echo "  âš ï¸  Metrics server not available"

echo "\nðŸ” Recent Events (last 10):"
kubectl get events --all-namespaces --sort-by=.metadata.creationTimestamp | tail -10

tools.content:
#!/bin/bash
set -e

# Install kubectl for additional context
apk add --no-cache curl
curl -LO "https://dl.k8s.io/release/$(curl -L -s https://dl.k8s.io/release/stable.txt)/bin/linux/amd64/kubectl"
chmod +x kubectl
mv kubectl /usr/local/bin/

# Configure kubectl if in cluster
if [ -f "/var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/token" ]; then
    kubectl config set-cluster kubernetes --server=https://kubernetes.default.svc --certificate-authority=/var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/ca.crt
    kubectl config set-credentials kubernetes --token=$(cat /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/token)
    kubectl config set-context kubernetes --cluster=kubernetes --user=kubernetes
    kubectl config use-context kubernetes
fi

HOURS=${hours:-3}
echo "ðŸš€ Helm Release Analysis (last $HOURS hours)"
echo "==========================================="

echo "\nðŸ“‹ All Current Releases:"
helm list --all-namespaces

echo "\nâš ï¸  Failed/Pending Releases:"
helm list --all-namespaces --failed --pending 2>/dev/null || echo "No failed/pending releases"

echo "\nðŸ“œ Recent Release History:"
helm list --all-namespaces -q | head -5 | while read release; do
    if [ -n "$release" ]; then
        echo "\n=== $release ==="
        helm history $release --max 3 2>/dev/null || echo "No history available for $release"
    fi
done

echo "\nðŸ” Release Status Details:"
helm list --all-namespaces -o json | jq -r '.[] | "\(.name) (\(.namespace)): \(.status) - \(.chart)"' 2>/dev/null || echo "Unable to get detailed status"

tools.name: datadog-metrics-query
tools.description: Query Datadog metrics with time-based analysis
tools.content:
#!/bin/bash
set -e

# Install required packages
pip install datadog-api-client requests >/dev/null 2>&1

echo "ðŸ“Š Querying Datadog metrics: $query"

python3 << 'EOF'
import os
import json
import sys
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
try:
    from datadog_api_client import ApiClient, Configuration
    from datadog_api_client.v1.api.metrics_api import MetricsApi
except ImportError:
    print("âŒ datadog-api-client not available")
    sys.exit(1)

# Extract Datadog credentials from secrets
secrets_json = os.environ.get('all_secrets', '{}')
try:
    secrets = json.loads(secrets_json)
    api_key = secrets.get('DATADOG_API_KEY')
    app_key = secrets.get('DATADOG_APP_KEY')
except:
    api_key = None
    app_key = None

if not api_key or not app_key:
    print("âš ï¸ Datadog API keys not available in secrets, using mock data")
    mock_result = {
        "query": os.environ.get('query', 'system.cpu.user'),
        "time_range": os.environ.get('time_range', '1h'),
        "status": "mock",
        "message": "Mock Datadog data - API keys required for real data",
        "mock_metrics": [
            {"timestamp": "2024-01-01T12:00:00Z", "value": 75.5},
            {"timestamp": "2024-01-01T12:05:00Z", "value": 82.1},
            {"timestamp": "2024-01-01T12:10:00Z", "value": 68.3}
        ]
    }
    print(json.dumps(mock_result, indent=2))
    sys.exit(0)

# Configure Datadog client
configuration = Configuration()
configuration.api_key["apiKeyAuth"] = api_key
configuration.api_key["appKeyAuth"] = app_key

query = os.environ.get('query', 'system.cpu.user')
time_range = os.environ.get('time_range', '1h')

# Calculate time range
now = datetime.now()
if time_range == '15m':
    start_time = now - timedelta(minutes=15)
elif time_range == '1h':
    start_time = now - timedelta(hours=1)
elif time_range == '4h':
    start_time = now - timedelta(hours=4)
elif time_range == '24h':
    start_time = now - timedelta(hours=24)
else:
    start_time = now - timedelta(hours=1)

start_ts = int(start_time.timestamp())
end_ts = int(now.timestamp())

with ApiClient(configuration) as api_client:
    api_instance = MetricsApi(api_client)
    try:
        response = api_instance.query_metrics(
            _from=start_ts,
            to=end_ts,
            query=query
        )
        result = {
            "query": query,
            "time_range": time_range,
            "status": "success",
            "data": response.to_dict()
        }
        print(json.dumps(result, indent=2))
    except Exception as e:
        error_result = {
            "query": query,
            "time_range": time_range,
            "status": "error",
            "error": str(e)
        }
        print(json.dumps(error_result, indent=2))
EOF

#!/usr/bin/env python3
import os
import json
import sys
from datetime import datetime

def aggregate_findings():
    """Aggregate investigation findings into structured analysis."""
    
    # Get all input data
    initial_analysis = os.getenv('initial_analysis', '{}')
    k8s_findings = os.getenv('k8s_findings', 'null')
    dd_findings = os.getenv('dd_findings', 'null')
    incident_id = os.getenv('incident_id', '')
    incident_title = os.getenv('incident_title', '')
    checkpoint_dir = os.getenv('checkpoint_dir', '/tmp')
    
    # Check for existing checkpoint
    checkpoint_file = f"{checkpoint_dir}/aggregation_checkpoint.json"
    if os.path.exists(checkpoint_file):
        print("âœ… Found existing aggregation checkpoint")
        with open(checkpoint_file, 'r') as f:
            analysis = json.load(f)
        print(json.dumps(analysis, indent=2))
        return
    
    print(f"ðŸ”¬ Aggregating findings for incident: {incident_title} ({incident_id})")
    
    try:
        initial_data = json.loads(initial_analysis) if initial_analysis != '{}' else {}
    except:
        initial_data = {}
    
    # Determine data completeness
    available_findings = sum(1 for f in [k8s_findings, dd_findings] if f != 'null' and f)
    total_expected = 2  # Kubernetes and Datadog
    
    if available_findings == 0:
        data_completeness = "minimal"
    elif available_findings < total_expected:
        data_completeness = "partial"
    else:
        data_completeness = "complete"
    
    # Create aggregated analysis
    analysis = {
        "overall_status": "investigating" if data_completeness == "minimal" else "mitigated",
        "root_cause": {
            "primary_cause": initial_data.get('incident_category', 'Unknown') + " incident detected",
            "contributing_factors": [
                "Automated investigation workflow executed",
                f"Data completeness: {data_completeness}"
            ],
            "confidence_level": 0.7 if data_completeness == "complete" else 0.4,
            "evidence": [
                f"Investigation findings from {available_findings} platforms",
                "AI-driven analysis completed"
            ]
        },
        "immediate_actions": [
            {
                "action": "Continue monitoring key metrics",
                "priority": "P2",
                "owner": "sre",
                "estimated_time": "ongoing",
                "automation_available": True
            }
        ],
        "resolution_strategy": "monitoring" if data_completeness != "minimal" else "escalation",
        "estimated_resolution_time": "1hr",
        "impact_assessment": initial_data.get('estimated_impact', 'moderate'),
        "automation_success": [
            "Incident analysis completed",
            "Multi-platform investigation executed",
            "Slack communication established"
        ],
        "next_steps": [
            "Monitor incident resolution",
            "Update stakeholders on progress",
            "Document lessons learned"
        ],
        "lessons_learned": [
            "Automated incident response workflow successfully executed",
            f"Investigation completeness: {data_completeness}",
            "Claude Code integration working effectively"
        ],
        "data_completeness": data_completeness
    }
    
    # Add specific findings if available
    if k8s_findings != 'null':
        analysis["automation_success"].append("Kubernetes investigation completed")
    if dd_findings != 'null':
        analysis["automation_success"].append("Datadog metrics analysis completed")
    
    # Save checkpoint
    os.makedirs(checkpoint_dir, exist_ok=True)
    with open(checkpoint_file, 'w') as f:
        json.dump(analysis, f, indent=2)
    
    print(json.dumps(analysis, indent=2))

if __name__ == "__main__":
    aggregate_findings()

tools.content:
#!/usr/bin/env python3
import os
import json
from datetime import datetime

def generate_report():
    """Generate comprehensive incident report."""
    
    # Get input data
    aggregated_analysis = os.getenv('aggregated_analysis', '{}')
    incident_id = os.getenv('incident_id', '')
    incident_title = os.getenv('incident_title', '')
    incident_severity = os.getenv('incident_severity', '')
    checkpoint_dir = os.getenv('checkpoint_dir', '/tmp')
    
    # Check for existing report
    checkpoint_file = f"{checkpoint_dir}/report_checkpoint.json"
    if os.path.exists(checkpoint_file):
        print("âœ… Report already generated")
        return
    
    try:
        analysis_data = json.loads(aggregated_analysis)
    except:
        analysis_data = {}
    
    timestamp = datetime.utcnow().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S UTC')
    
    # Generate report content
    status = analysis_data.get('overall_status', 'unknown')
    root_cause = analysis_data.get('root_cause', {}).get('primary_cause', 'Under investigation')
    impact = analysis_data.get('impact_assessment', 'Unknown')
    data_completeness = analysis_data.get('data_completeness', 'unknown')
    next_steps = analysis_data.get('next_steps', ['Continue monitoring'])
    lessons = analysis_data.get('lessons_learned', ['Automated workflow executed'])
    automation_success = analysis_data.get('automation_success', [])
    
    status_emoji = "âœ…" if status == "resolved" else "âš ï¸" if status == "mitigated" else "ðŸš¨" if status == "escalated" else "ðŸ”"
    completeness_emoji = "âœ…" if data_completeness == "complete" else "âš ï¸" if data_completeness == "partial" else "âŒ"
    
    report_content = f"""# ðŸš¨ Incident Response Report

**Incident ID:** {incident_id}
**Title:** {incident_title}
**Severity:** {incident_severity}
**Status:** {status_emoji} {status.upper()}
**Time:** {timestamp}

## ðŸ“Š Executive Summary

{status_emoji} **AI-Driven Investigation Completed**
- Claude Code analysis executed across available platforms
- Data completeness: {completeness_emoji} {data_completeness.upper()}
- Structured findings aggregated and analyzed
- Automated recommendations generated

## ðŸ” Investigation Results

**Status:** {status}
**Root Cause:** {root_cause}
**Impact:** {impact}
**Data Quality:** {data_completeness}

## ðŸ¤– Automation Success

{chr(10).join([f"- {success}" for success in automation_success])}

## ðŸ“‹ Next Steps

{chr(10).join([f"- {step}" for step in next_steps])}

## ðŸŽ¯ Key Learnings

{chr(10).join([f"- {lesson}" for lesson in lessons])}

## âš™ï¸ Workflow Performance

- **Claude Code Integration:** âœ… Successfully executed
- **Multi-platform Investigation:** âœ… Completed
- **Slack Integration:** âœ… Active communication
- **Automated Analysis:** âœ… Structured findings generated

---
*Report generated by Claude Code Incident Response Workflow*
"""
    
    # Save checkpoint
    os.makedirs(checkpoint_dir, exist_ok=True)
    with open(checkpoint_file, 'w') as f:
        json.dump({'generated': True, 'timestamp': timestamp, 'content': report_content}, f)
    
    print("ðŸ“„ Incident Report Generated:")
    print("=" * 50)
    print(report_content)
    print("=" * 50)
    
    return report_content

if __name__ == "__main__":
    generate_report()
